{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2995472,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T20:37:23.186Z","cooked":"

It’s come to my attention that there’s a regression in our binding software that have broken support for the CTRE libraries at this time. I’ll take a look tonight, but I don’t have an estimate for a fix at this time.

For more information see:

  • https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-ctre/issues/142
  • https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-build/pull/156

And if you happen to be a C++ expert who has experience with pybind11, I welcome your input

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T20:37:37.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":24,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":142.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400891,"topic_slug":"robotpy-ctre-2022-is-currently-broken","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-ctre/issues/142","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10},{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-build/pull/156","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-ctre-2022-is-currently-broken/400891/1","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2995783,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-21T08:57:53.601Z","cooked":"

Status update: I’ve root caused the issue to a pybind11 regression (investigation details in PR linked below). No idea how to fix it yet, but will think about it. If you’re awesome at C++, you can fix it for me!

github.com/pybind/pybind11

[smart_holder] Add tests demonstrating smart_holder issues with multiple inheritance

pybind:smart_holder ← robotpy:smart-holder-mvi
opened 08:52AM - 21 Jan 22 UTC
virtuald
+194 -0

This will be fixed in 2022.0.4.

I might need to rebuild the entire RobotPy release for this update, but I don’t have time to do that tonight… but my minimal testing indicates that it might just work as is, so I’m going to push a new robotpy-ctre release tonight. Please let me know if you run into further crashes!

I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong, but should the segmentation fault be fixed if robotpy-ctre is updated to 2022.0.4? We updated ctre to 2022.0.4, but we still get the same error:

image2082×942 99.8 KB

We no longer get the segmentation fault. Our code had some other errors that were fixed and we now have a bare chassis with 4 talonfx motors and an xbox controller that is running correctly.

Github link:

github.com

2021-2022_FRC_Season/Sidius at main · SteelRidgeRobotics/2021-2022_FRC_Season

main/Sidius

This is where we will keep our code. Contribute to SteelRidgeRobotics/2021-2022_FRC_Season development by creating an account on GitHub.
